bug.short_desc: Table API Doc Refers to Unsuitable Demo

long_desc.thetext:
The table.Table's API documentation refers to a specific demo. In its class doc, it says about Meta columns:
"Take the demo http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/demobrowser/#table~Table.html as example: If you make your browser window very small (or make one of the columns very wide) so the table needs horizontal scrolling, then the left column stays always visible. This is because the left column is one meta-column and the other columns are in another."
But the corresponding demo doesn't work as described. It doesn't use meta columns, and consequently the left column is not fixed when scrolling horizontally, but moves together with the others.
Either the class doc or the demo should be adapted.

Hopefully there is still a demo that shows use of multiple meta columns. The documentation should point to that demo. If such a demo has disappeared, it should, I think, reappear. That's a pretty important concept in the Table.
